text.0: to you pure juice rich in meath are offered by priest through longing for the pair of heroes.
text.1: drive vāyu bring thine harnessed horses hither drink the pressed soma till it make thee joyful.
text.2: whoso to thee the mighty brings oblation pure soma unto thee puredrinking vāyu.
text.3: that man thou makest famous among mortals to him strong sons are born in quick succession.
text.4: the god whom both these worlds brought forth for riches whom heavenly dhiṣaṇā for our wealth appointeth.
text.5: his team of harnessed horses waits on vāyu and foremost on the radiant treasurebearer.
text.6: the spotless dawns with fair bright days have broken they found the spacious light when they were shining.
text.7: eagerly they disclosed the stall of cattle floods streamed for them as in the days aforetime.
text.8: these with their truthful spirit shining brightly move on provided with their natural insight.
text.9: viands attend the car that beareth heroes your car ye sovran pair indra and vāyu.
text.10: may these who give us heavenly light these rulers with gifts of kine and horses gold and treasures.
text.11: these princes through full life indra and vāyu oercome in battle with their steeds and heroes.
text.12: like coursers seeking fame will we vasisthas o indravāyu with our fair laudations.
text.13: exerting all our power call you to aid us preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
